intro: Ecbolium origanoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its botanical structure includes a robust root system and a branched stem. Ecbolium origanoides is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wet meadows.
